thread.title: Former Cavaliers player Daniel 'Boobie' Gibson leaving NBA for rap career
thread.title_full: Former Cavaliers player Daniel 'Boobie' Gibson leaving NBA for rap career | cleveland.com

author: Troy L. Smith, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Former Cavaliers player Daniel 'Boobie' Gibson leaving NBA for rap career
text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio – Daniel "Boobie" Gibson, best known for being buddy-buddy with LeBron James during his seven seasons with the Cleveland Cavaliers is done being a player in favor of being a "playa."
Cleveland Cavaliers' Daniel Gibson guard Daniel Gibson in 2010. Joshua Gunter Gibson joined Power 105's "The Breakfast Club" radio show in New York City Friday morning to announce he was leaving the NBA to pursue a career as a rapper.
To be clear, Gibson hasn't played in the NBA since a stint with the Cavs during the 2012-2013 season. Thus, some people on Twitter are suggesting the NBA actually quit Gibson before he could quit the NBA.
"I'm gonna give up my NBA career to start rapping," Gibson said on air. The response from "The Breakfast Club" host Charlamagne Tha God was somewhat comical:
"Who you think a better rapper, you or Birdman?" Charlamagne asked Gibson.
Gibson then dropped some lyrics that were more of a spoken word: " My biggest competition is reflection."
Here's how Twitter reacted to Gibson's rap aspirations:
Boobie Gibson leaving the NBA to pursue rap?... pic.twitter.com/NxviR3DZgk
— The Realest Realist (@SeanTheTerrible) October 9, 2015
Lmao boobie Gibson was on the breakfast club talking bout "I'm gonna give up my NBA career to start rapping" bruh what NBA career ?!?!
— Nick Tee (@NickTeezy) October 9, 2015
Boobie Gibson hasn't been relevant in the NBA since Bron was in Cleveland the first time. He had plenty of time to write raps
— Creepy Old Man (@Pattric) October 9, 2015
Boobie Gibson want to be an artist! Let that man follow his dream! His money is right so he can do this. At least he's not following ppl!
— N.G.504 (@NiceGuy504) October 9, 2015
Boobie Gibson leaving the NBA to pursue a rap career. That's a stupid decision.
— Risky (@wavycrockett7) October 9, 2015
Lebron the only reason Boobie Gibson played as long as he did he would've been out the league
— Auto Co-Wreck (@TyLu82) October 9, 2015
